# all methods related to starting and finishing the runs go in here
import os
import time
import shutil
import numpy as np

import executables

from termcolor import colored
from tqdm import tqdm

from cluster_manager import set_default_oscar_cluster_from_alias
from utils import get_command_output_wrapped, auto_mkdir

from jmeterLoadInjector.main import main as jmeter

import global_parameters as gp


# wait between the upload of two files, to emulate arrival rate
# not a boolean to allow adding new distributions

[docs]def wait_interval(distribution, inter_upload_time):
    wait = 0
    if distribution == "exponential":
        wait = round(float(max(inter_upload_time, np.random.exponential(inter_upload_time, 1))), 2)
    elif distribution == "deterministic":
        wait = inter_upload_time
    return wait



# move files to the input bucket, starting the workflow execution

[docs]def move_input_files_to_input_bucket(service):
    print(colored("Moving input files...", "yellow"))
    storage_bucket, filename, batch_size, number_of_batches, distribution, inter_upload_time = get_workflow_input_async()

    if not gp.is_single_service_test:
        if gp.is_sync:
            use_jmeter(service)
            return
        else:
            move_from_storage(service, filename, batch_size, number_of_batches, distribution, inter_upload_time)
            get_input_files_count(service)

    else:  # is single service test
        service_name = service["name"]
        service_distribution = gp.components_names[service_name].time_distribution

        if gp.is_sync:
            if service_distribution is None:  # first service
                use_jmeter(service)
            else:
                duplicate_bucket_sync(service, storage_bucket, service["input_bucket"], service_distribution)
        else:
            duplicate_bucket(service, storage_bucket, service["input_bucket"], number_of_batches,
                             service_distribution, inter_upload_time)

    return




[docs]def get_input_files_count(service):
    minio_alias = service["storage_provider_alias"]
    source = minio_alias + "/" + service["input_bucket"]
    set_default_oscar_cluster_from_alias(service["oscarcli_alias"])
    command = executables.mc.get_command("ls " + source + "/")
    file_list = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    gp.input_files_count = len(file_list)
    print(gp.input_files_count, "input files found")
    return




[docs]def move_from_storage(service, filename, batch_size, number_of_batches, distribution, inter_upload_time):
    minio_alias = service["storage_provider_alias"]
    stripped_filename, extension = filename.split(".")
    input_bucket = minio_alias + "/" + service["input_bucket"]
    storage_bucket = minio_alias + "/" + "storage"

    for i in range(0, number_of_batches):
        for j in range(0, batch_size):
            destination_file = stripped_filename + "_" + str(i*batch_size+j) + "." + extension
            move_file_between_buckets(filename, storage_bucket, destination_file, input_bucket)

        wait = wait_interval(distribution, inter_upload_time)
        time.sleep(wait)
    print(colored("Done!", "green"))
    return




[docs]def use_jmeter(service):
    service_name = service["name"]

    command = executables.oscar_cli.get_command("cluster list")
    data = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    for line in data:
        if service["cluster"] in line:
            endpoint = line.split()[1][1:-1]

    command = executables.oscar_cli.get_command("cluster default -s oscar-%s" % service["cluster"])
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)

    command = executables.oscar_cli.get_command("service get %s" % service["name"])
    data = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    for line in data:
        if "token" in line:
            token = line.split()[-1]

    # print(service_name, endpoint, token)

    if gp.is_debug:
        current_work_dir = os.getcwd() + "/"
    else:
        current_work_dir = "/"

    os.chdir("jmeterLoadInjector")

    input_file_name = "Test-Video.mp4"
    oscarp_dir = current_work_dir + gp.application_dir + "oscarp/"
    input_file = oscarp_dir + "input_files/" + input_file_name
    jmeter_dir = oscarp_dir + "jmeter_files/"

    if not gp.is_debug:
        jmeter_dir = "/tmp/jmeter_files/"

    auto_mkdir(jmeter_dir)
    jmeter_results_file = jmeter_dir + "results.csv"

    if os.path.exists(jmeter_results_file):
        os.remove(jmeter_results_file)

    configuration = {
        'cluster_endpoint': endpoint,
        'oscar_service': service_name,
        'token': token,
        'input_file': input_file,
        'connect_timeout_seconds': gp.run_parameters["synchronous"]["connect_timeout_seconds"],
        'request_timeout_seconds': gp.run_parameters["synchronous"]["request_timeout_seconds"],
        'tests': gp.run_parameters["synchronous"]["intervals"]
    }

    jmeter(jmeter_dir, configuration)

    os.chdir(current_work_dir)

    destination = "%sRun #%s/jmeter_results.csv" % (gp.runs_dir, gp.current_run_index)

    shutil.copyfile(jmeter_results_file, destination)

    return



"""
def move_input_files_to_dead_start_bucket(service):
    print(colored("Moving input files...", "yellow"))
    minio_alias = service["minio_alias"]
    storage_bucket = minio_alias + "/" + "storage"
    input_bucket = minio_alias + "/" + "dead-start"

    filename, number_of_files, distribution, inter_upload_time = get_workflow_input()
    stripped_filename, extension = filename.split(".")

    for i in tqdm(range(0, number_of_files)):
        destination_file = stripped_filename + "_" + str(i) + "." + extension
        move_file_between_buckets(filename, storage_bucket, destination_file, input_bucket)

        wait = wait_interval(distribution, inter_upload_time)
        time.sleep(wait)
    print(colored("Done!", "green"))
    return
"""


# origin and destination bucket must already include the minio_alias, i.e. "minio-vm/storage"

[docs]def move_file_between_buckets(origin_file, origin_bucket, destination_file, destination_bucket):
    origin = origin_bucket + "/" + origin_file
    destination = destination_bucket + "/" + destination_file
    # command = mc + "cp " + origin + " " + destination
    command = executables.mc.get_command("cp " + origin + " " + destination)
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    return




[docs]def duplicate_bucket(service, source_bucket, destination_bucket, number_of_batches, distribution, inter_upload_time):
    print(colored("Duplicating bucket...", "yellow"))
    minio_alias = service["storage_provider_alias"]
    source = minio_alias + "/" + source_bucket
    destination = minio_alias + "/" + destination_bucket
    set_default_oscar_cluster_from_alias(service["oscarcli_alias"])
    command = executables.mc.get_command("ls " + source + "/")
    file_list = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    batch_size = int(len(file_list) / gp.input_files_count)

    counter = 0
    for file in file_list:

        filename = file.split()[5]
        command = executables.mc.get_command("cp %s/%s %s/%s" % (source, filename, destination, filename))
        # print(command)
        get_command_output_wrapped(command)

        counter += 1

        if counter >= batch_size:
            counter = 0

            wait = wait_interval(distribution, inter_upload_time)
            time.sleep(wait)

    print(colored("Done!", "green"))
    return




[docs]def duplicate_bucket_sync(service, source_bucket, destination_bucket, distribution):
    print(colored("Duplicating bucket...", "yellow"))
    minio_alias = service["storage_provider_alias"]
    source = minio_alias + "/" + source_bucket
    destination = minio_alias + "/" + destination_bucket
    set_default_oscar_cluster_from_alias(service["oscarcli_alias"])
    command = executables.mc.get_command("ls " + source + "/")
    file_list = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    batch_size = int(len(file_list) / gp.input_files_count)

    for interval in gp.run_parameters["synchronous"]["intervals"]:
        throughput = interval["throughput"]
        duration = interval["duration_seconds"]

        inter_upload_time = 1 / (throughput / 60)
        batch_number_counter = round(duration / inter_upload_time, 0)

        batch_size_counter = 0
        for file in file_list:

            filename = file.split()[5]
            command = executables.mc.get_command("cp %s/%s %s/%s" % (source, filename, destination, filename))
            # print(command)
            get_command_output_wrapped(command)

            batch_size_counter += 1

            if batch_size_counter >= batch_size:
                batch_size_counter = 0

                batch_number_counter -= 1
                if batch_number_counter <= 0:
                    break

                print("pausing")
                wait = wait_interval(distribution, inter_upload_time)
                time.sleep(wait)

    print(colored("Done!", "green"))
    return




[docs]def move_input_files_to_s3_bucket(input_bucket):
    print(colored("Duplicating bucket...", "yellow"))
    base_bucket = input_bucket.split('/')[0]
    temp_bucket = base_bucket + "/temp_bucket/"
    input_bucket += "/"

    command = "aws s3 cp s3://" + input_bucket + " s3://" + temp_bucket
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)

    command = "aws s3 mv s3://" + input_bucket + " s3://" + temp_bucket + " --recursive"
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)

    command = "aws s3 mv s3://" + temp_bucket + " s3://" + input_bucket + " --recursive"
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)

    print(colored("Done!", "green"))



# given a service, returns the list of jobs with their status

[docs]def get_jobs_list(service_name, oscarcli_alias):

    set_default_oscar_cluster_from_alias(oscarcli_alias)

    # command = oscar_cli + "service logs list " + service_name
    command = executables.oscar_cli.get_command("service logs list " + service_name)
    logs_list = get_command_output_wrapped(command)

    if logs_list:
        logs_list.pop(0)

    job_list = []

    for line in logs_list:
        segments = line.split('\t')
        job_name = segments[0]
        job_status = segments[1]

        job_list.append({
            "name": job_name,
            "status": job_status
        })

    return job_list




[docs]def increment_sleep(sleep):
    max_wait = 300
    sleep += round(sleep / 2)
    if sleep > max_wait:
        return max_wait
    return sleep



# awaits the completion of all the jobs before passing to processing

[docs]def wait_services_completion(services):
    for service in services:
        if service["is_lambda"]:
            wait_lambda_completion(service)
        else:
            wait_oscar_service_completion(service)

    return




[docs]def wait_oscar_service_completion(service):
    service_name = service["name"]

    service_distribution = gp.components_names[service_name].time_distribution

    if service_distribution is None and gp.is_sync:  # first service
        return

    # sleep_interval = 10
    completed = False
    service_name = service["name"].replace("_", "-")
    # cluster = get_active_cluster(service, clusters)
    print(colored("Waiting for service " + service_name + " completion...", "yellow"))

    # before considering the service completed it'll wait for a bit more
    retries_counter = 3
    sleep_timer_seconds = 60

    pbar = tqdm()
    old_pending_jobs = 0

    while not completed:
        job_list = get_jobs_list(service_name, service["oscarcli_alias"])
        pbar.total = len(job_list)
        pbar.refresh()

        time.sleep(sleep_timer_seconds)

        pending_jobs = 0

        i = len(job_list)
        if job_list:  # if list not empty
            completed = True
            for j in job_list:
                if j["status"] == "Running":
                    completed = False
                    i -= 1
                elif j["status"] == "Pending":
                    pending_jobs += 1
                    i -= 1

        # completed is true if there are no jobs running, everything is either completed or pending

        pbar.n = i
        pbar.refresh()

        if not completed:  # resets the counter
            retries_counter = 3
        else:
            # if there are no running jobs and the number of pending is under 5%,
            # and it stays the same (meaning every job is either finished or stuck)
            if len(job_list)/100*5 > pending_jobs == old_pending_jobs:
                if retries_counter != 0:
                    completed = False
                    retries_counter -= 1
            else:  # if I reach here it means everything is pending
                completed = False

        old_pending_jobs = pending_jobs

        if gp.is_debug:
            print(colored("\tPending jobs: %s, Checks completed: (%s/3)"
                          % (pending_jobs, 3 - retries_counter), "magenta"))

    pbar.close()

    print(colored("\nService " + service_name + " completed!", "green"))
    return



# todo this isn't done yet, finish it

[docs]def wait_lambda_completion(service):
    service_name = service["name"]
    print(colored("Waiting for service " + service_name + " completion...", "yellow"))

    completed = False

    retries_counter = 3
    sleep_timer_seconds = 10
    old_log_length = 0

    while not completed:

        time.sleep(sleep_timer_seconds)

        command = "aws logs describe-log-streams --log-group-name /aws/lambda/%s" % service_name
        log_streams = get_command_output_wrapped(command)

        log_stream_names = [line for line in log_streams if "logStreamName" in line]
        log_stream_names = [line.split()[1].replace("\"", "")[:-1] for line in log_stream_names]

        total_length = 0

        for log_stream_name in log_stream_names:
            command = "aws logs get-log-events --log-group-name /aws/lambda/%s --log-stream-name %s" \
                      % (service_name, log_stream_name)

            log = get_command_output_wrapped(command)
            total_length += len(log)

        print(colored("\tTotal length: %s" % total_length, "magenta"))

        if total_length == old_log_length:
            if retries_counter != 0:
                completed = False
                retries_counter -= 1
            else:
                completed = True

        old_log_length = total_length

    print(colored("Service " + service_name + " completed!", "green"))
    return



"""
def download_bucket(destination, bucket_name):
    print(colored("Downloading bucket...", "yellow"))
    mc_alias = get_mc_alias()
    origin = mc_alias + "/" + bucket_name
    auto_mkdir(destination)
    command = "oscar-p/mc cp " + origin + " " + destination + " -r"
    get_command_output_wrapped(command)
    print(colored("Done!", "green"))
